item.title: Portal Problem
item.dc:creator: @warlok warlok
item.description:
@warlok wrote:

case 7319: // barrowportal if(combat >= 60); teleportToX = 3565; teleportToY = 3312; sendMessage("you teleport to the Barrows area."); sendMessage("type ::barrows for info"); }else{ SendMessage("barrows is 60 combat or above only"); break;

He wanted 60 cb +

item.title: Portal Problem
item.dc:creator: @gs1 gs
item.description:
@gs1 wrote:

case 7319: // barrowportal
teleportToX = 3565;
teleportToY = 3312;
sendMessage(“you teleport to the Barrows area.”);
sendMessage(“type ::barrows for info”);
break;

this is mine… it works… real barrows area portal is 7319

Read full topic

item.title: Portal Problem
item.dc:creator: @warlok warlok
item.description:
@warlok wrote:

or try

[quote=“warlok, post:2, topic:198573”]wouldn’t it be

if (objectID == 4154) && combat >= 60 { teleportToX = 3551; teleportToY = 9706; itemMessage("Welcome to the Barrows Area.", "", 1291, 250); sendMessage("Use the two banks to your left and right to store obtained items!"); } else { sendMessage("You must be at least 60 Combat to use this portal."); } } idk but ive seen it more that way[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Portal Problem
item.dc:creator: @Pku_Skillz Pku Skillz
item.description:
@Pku_Skillz wrote:

I’m trying to add a portal that teleports you to another room (barrows). Here’s the code I’m trying:

if (objectID == 4154) { if (combat >= 60) { teleportToX = 3551; teleportToY = 9706; itemMessage("Welcome to the Barrows Area.", "", 1291, 250); sendMessage("Use the two banks to your left and right to store obtained items!"); } else { sendMessage("You must be at least 60 Combat to use this portal."); } }

I compile with my compiler, then run my server. The portal shows up, but when I click on it, nothing happens. What a I doing wrong?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 11, 2008, 04:06:20 AM[/size][hr]Will someone help me?

Read full topic
